text:
Hello, Team !
Can Any one help me how to get  specific ticket related all properties with api?

hi team!
‘<https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/campaigns/by-id/>’
this api is responding with campaign id that appears to be ‘internal HubSpot id’
but issue with this is that there can be multiple ‘internal HubSpot id’ for single campaign.
where can i get the UUID version of campaign id using API?

Hi! I'm not a coder so forgive my ineptitude! I use <http://Monday.com|Monday.com> for work management and I want to API data on Landing Page activity, Documents and Email OUT of HubSpot and into <http://Monday.com|Monday.com>. <http://Monday.com|Monday.com> has SOME existing integration capability, but not for data like this. Is this data transference possible and is there a non-tech way to do it....or do I need to engage someone with coding expertise? I thank you all.
<@U7SL518D6> <@U03MLCLS5BN> any update? This is affecting live clients
webhooks fire on updates. typically a database to store those them delaying any processing after deal creation on a delay would allow you to have all those updates then process the data.
you could use something like zapier and try to make that work. less techy than anything else out there

Sorry for some reason didn’t see your DM right away. I’ve passed it on to the engineers, can you send me the CRM Object id that your’e seeing this on? that’d help them ensure they’re looking at the right record
no worries, will pm and thanks
although it effects everyone sincec it looks like last week?
In our testing we’re seeing everything still in miliseconds. So the issue seems localized to this account.
weird it looks like it reverted to milliseconds last night
cuz now theyre back to being correct
but this account is fubared anyways, it has the broken serverless functions

weird, to my knowledge the team didn’t do anything but I can relay that it’s showing correctly now.

I’m unclear about what you’re saying about serverless functions here though sounds like a separate issue. What’s going on with your serverless functions?
it was a few months ago, it had some kind of fatal error where if you updated a secret via the CLI it would make serverless functions not work on the account
so the account is already wonky
did you ever contact support about that? that sounds bizarre, and not really sure how that would happen. If there’s a bug like that we’d like to get it fixed
yeah, they got them back running again we just can't use the CLI

???

Unsure what would cause that but did you try generating a new personal access key for the CLI?
yep
it was a big ordeal, took you guys like 2 months to fix
so this account has a history of wonkiness
huh, well I’m sorry to hear that it happend and that it wasn’t a quick fix. I’ve honestly never heard of that issue happening before.
no worries
I think what happened was we were using the CLI and in the background you guys made live the deployment stuff for serverless functions on the UI so it was just bad timing i think
<@U7SL518D6> okay, it seems like alot of stuff broke that we're finding out now in regards to calls
getting a list together fror you now
seems to be related to the UI change

this seems to be the biggest one:

```
if you try to listen to the recording of a transferred call, it has the correct time (on the customer page only - the call page link i sent you above only shows it as 30 seconds) so in this case, customer page shows the 5 minute call time but on listening to it, it cuts off after 30 seconds. So the system is somehow aware that the call was 5 min long but the recording and transcript fails on transfer```
```HubSpot updated the Call UI which now has recipients and it is not pulling in the associated contact```
so seems to be mostly front-end related with the UI changes

Odd… If you go to <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/support-inbox/> what’s the ticket id for the support conversation you had (shows in the URL when you click on the ticket)

Just wanting to see the conversation and try to do some checking internally to ensure the engineers have all the info they need to ensure other accounts don’t end up in the state you’re experiencing and also hopefully the issue with that account can be figured out too.
we havent opened a support issue yet, usually it takes like a week of wasting time before they get to escalate, but I can create one for ya

Well, I guess I would base the decision on whether to make a ticket on whether you care to make that portal work properly again not based on me.
It seems like you have some possible conclusions about the cause of the problems, but haven’t  yet worked with support to validate them and troubleshoot them. Unless I can show the teams the issues happening in a portal it’s hard for them to know whether their fixes truly address the problem.  Support ticket is a way to do that.

I understand that not all of our support team are developers, and so unfortunately it can sometimes take them a little bit to understand the root issue on technical stuff. If you feel like you’re experiencing that you can flag it here and one of our developer advocates will do our best to help escalate the ticket when warranted.
I just don't see the point in wasting my or my clients time playing mickey mouse with support
when I can come here and put HubSpot on the spot :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there a way to set up a trigger to listen for when a HubSpot Quote has been paid?

Well thing is, here there’s no SLA. This is not a support area. HubSpotters who participate in this slack are here out of their own goodwill and desire to connect with developers in our community.

By contacting support that support person is dedicated to advocating for you internally to help get your issue resolved in a timely manner. If you reach out on here and you have a support ticket we can assist the support person in escalating if necessary - ensuring engineering can resolve the problem for you, and in the event anyone else is affected, they can fix it for everyone.
so the answer is yes I should open a ticket lol
If you want the issue fixed, yes.
How come we don't receive notifications about potential breaking changes? This isn't the first time it's happened
In regard to all of HubSpot, not just this
<@UD53A9UUR> we haven’t heard back from support yet. could you please take a look?

We do issue notifications and we do also have a public changelog so that everyone building on the platform or using the platform, regardless of their access in their HubSpot account - they can see what’s changed or changing.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog>

For breaking changes unless they are security, legal, or to a beta feature, we provide a minimum of 90 days notice.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition>

Right now for the issues you’re talking about we haven’t been able to reproduce them, so we need more information to be able to fix them, and the issues you’re claiming don’t reflect any breaking changes that I’m aware of.
oh wow didn't know those existed, cool
yeah there was some kind of change a few months ago that crept up, wonder if it was in here all this time
<@U7SL518D6> does the breaking changes go into the changelog 90 days before or are they somewheres else?

You can subscribe to the changelog to get an instant notification that way it doesn’t matter what role you have in a HubSpot account you’ll still get notified.

Notifications for technical breaking changes that affect specific accounts - we typically will notify accounts based on their settings in
<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/account-and-billing/company>
Often it’s the Technical Admin that gets the notification, and Primary account contact.
dang that feature needs the ability to alert others too
good to know though, thank you

Well, we’d encourage using the changelog’s email subscription feature for everyone who you’d want to be notified of technical changes. That works better for say Solutions partners, where they may not have control over the HubSpot account’s points of contact etc.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-recording-transcripts-api-replaces-hs_call_recording_url-for-call-engagements>

this wasn't 90 days though this was....3
September 30th 2024 is more than 90 days
so hs_call_recording_url just flat out doesn't work anymore? or is it _only_ if we want transcription
it should work as it did before until September 30th 2024
any idea what date it originally got pushed live?
trying to see if it cocinides with our problems
The new API is live, but the change to the engagements API was not pushed live, and will not be live until September 30th, 2024
gotcha, so the old Calls Engadgement API wil lbe sunset then
Only the ability to send recordings and have them transcribed via the Engagements API. The API itself will still function it just won’t let you do that 1 feature
gotcha interesting
and the transcription is related to the new front end I presume
i'm just trying to organize these for support since they're going to ask anyways , thanks for the help

Changes to the HubSpot App’s front end would largely be unrelated to this API changing. The front-end works off the underlying data you submit but a change in the API does not directly correlate to any changes or even API calls made in the HubSpot front-end.
interesting
so what pieces of information are most helpful anyways for the devs then through support?
like you said example records that makes sense

Treat it like you’d want your client to treat you. An analogy if it helps:
If you bring your car to a mechanic, don’t tell them “My car is broken, fix it”.

You tell them “My car’s been making this weird noise, it started a few days ago after I had to stop suddenly. Seems to happen when I’m using the brakes”
ok

So giving them information like what record you experienced the issue with, rough idea of when you noticed the issue, what you were trying to do. etc.

With all that it’s Supports job to compile that info, either diagnose the issue directly, or escalate it. If they escalate it, you’ll still be talking to the same support person, but they’re backed by our engineers and other team members working together to help you.
I presume they're able to capture screenshots and such?

they can, but it’s helpful when you provide screen captures to them because depending on what issues are happening a problem may not be reproducible on their end (Example an issue could be related to a specific CDN node or something). It also helps prevent confusion, For example if you’re wording of something can be interpreted in more than one way, then a screenshot helps ensure folks are on the same page.
cool thanks

Hi, is there a way to get contact_id for form submission?
I don't know how Fivetran got this contact_form_submission table, it contains the 3 columns I really need: name, timestamp and contact_id.
I need to replicate it by calling API. What I'm missing now is the contact_id corresponds to the form submission. I'm able to get the form name, the timestamp.
<https://fivetran.github.io/dbt_HubSpot/#!/source/source.HubSpot_source.HubSpot.contact_form_submission>
Zapier will work if your need is standard. if you have more customized needs, you may need to loop a developer in. (We offer this kind of service, you can also pm me for it)

Hello Everyone, I need help to pull HubSpot custom report data using report IDs.

Since, they isn't any native way to pull it. Are you aware of any workaround which can do this for me ?
